snippet: High school students are graduating with many more science credits that could pave the way to careers in science and technology.
abstract: High school students are taking more advanced science and math courses than ever and graduating with many more science credits that could pave way to careers in science and technology; increase is result of tougher school requirements in response to widening demand for students with scientific and technical training.

byline.original: By HANNAH FAIRFIELD and JOSH KELLER

lead_paragraph: High school students are graduating with many more science credits that could pave the way to careers in science and technology.

headline.print_headline: In High School, Going Beyond the Basics
